intro: Gymnocoronis, commonly known as the naked crown, is a genus of flowering plants belonging to the family Apiaceae. These plants are characterized by their hollow, cylindrical stems and often fragrant, compound leaves. The flowers are typically small and clustered in umbels, a feature common in the carrot family. Gymnocoronis species are native to various regions of Europe and Asia, often growing in moist or calcareous soils. They are generally herbaceous perennials, though some species may be annual.
